speaker: Donald Trump
vclaim: In the 2016 presidential election, he says, "I won one of 42 points -- 42 points -- West Virginia."
date: stated on August 13, 2019 in a speech in Monaca, Pa.:
title: Did Donald Trump win West Virginia at 42 points in 2016?
text: In a rally in the south-west of neighbouring Pennsylvania, President Donald Trump Bok won the 2016 presidential election in West Virginia. "I won one of 42 points -- 42 points -- West Virginia," said Trump in his August 13 speech in Monaca, Papa. That would be a big win. Was his victory in the state of mountain climbers this big? The Trump campaign referred to the official results on the website of Foreign Minister West Virginia, which showed that Trump won West Virginia by 68.63 per cent, and exceeded his democratic rival, Hillary Clinton, by 26.48 per cent. The difference is 42.15 percentage points -- exactly what Trump said. West Virginia accounted for a second-scale Tramp victory in any state, up from 46.29 per cent WYOMING. He mentioned Greg Kelly on January 11, 2021 in a television section that says Joe Biden is on a video that announces fraud in the election at the Confession. By Bill McCarthy: January 12, 2021, 2016 results were also the last sign of the widening gap between Republicans and Democrats in West Virginia, a country where Democrats once dominated. The following graph shows how the margins of democratic victory in the presidential race shrunk between 1992 and 1996, and then produced ever-expanding margins of ribobilic victory. As noted by the Pio Research Centre, this pattern coincided with greater harmonization of national party policies with certain demographic factors, particularly race, educational attainment and population density. Geographical regions that are less ethnically diverse, less educated in colleges and more rural areas have turned strongly on the Republican Party in recent years, particularly in elections at the federal level. When the Governance magazine recently analysed all 50 states on these three demographic factors, West Virginia found that it had the strongest pro-public demographic in any state. Our Governor Trump said that in the 2016 presidential election in West Virginia, he won 42 points. He's right; in fact, this was his second margin in any state, where only Wyoming was tracked. We're evaluating the statement right.
